snippet: The Committee to Protect Journalists said 70 news workers were killed on the job last year, a 43 percent rise from 2011.
abstract: Committee to Protect Journalists reports that 70 journalists were killed in action during 2012, up 43 percent from 2011, and that more than 35 journalists disappeared; says number of journalists imprisoned rose to 232, 53 more than previous year and highest toll since survey began in 1990; attributes trend to repressive laws, government intolerance of dissent and impunity of killers.
lead_paragraph: The Committee to Protect Journalists said 70 news workers were killed on the job last year, a 43 percent rise from 2011.

headline.seo: Attacks on Journalists Rose in 2012, Group Finds
headline.main: Report Sees Journalists Increasingly Under Attack
headline.print_headline: Report Sees Journalists Increasingly Under Attack
